title: How to Sew a Map Holder

steps.headline: Lay out the piece of fabric.
steps.description: The best fabric to use is strong fabric that can take being tossed around a bit. You might even consider using fabric that has some waterproofing qualities if rain or water damage is a possibility.

steps.headline: Press the 35cm (13.5") length edges over once.
steps.description: Then repeat. Stitch in place either by hand or using a sewing machine. Fancy stitching isn't necessary but you might like to make it look decorative.

steps.headline: Turn the top and bottom 50cm (19.5") length edges over.
Fold the 35 centimeter (13.8 in) edges in by 10cm (4") each side.
steps.description: Keep fabric the wrong side up. When folded, the right side will face out. Pin in position––these become the map sleeves.

steps.headline: Sew a seam across the top and bottom of the holder.
steps.description: This seam will keep the sleeves in place and completes the sewing.

steps.headline: Slip in a piece of slim cardboard as a backing.
steps.description: Slip inside one sleeve one side, then into the other sleeve on the other side. Fold the map holder in half to complete.

steps.headline: Add the map.
steps.description: It's now ready to hit the road!

text: Lay out the piece of fabric. The best fabric to use is strong fabric that can take being tossed around a bit. You might even consider using fabric that has some waterproofing qualities if rain or water damage is a possibility. Press the 35cm (13.5") length edges over once. Then repeat. Stitch in place either by hand or using a sewing machine. Fancy stitching isn't necessary but you might like to make it look decorative. Turn the top and bottom 50cm (19.5") length edges over. Then repeat. Press. Fold the 35 centimeter (13.8 in) edges in by 10cm (4") each side. Keep fabric the wrong side up. When folded, the right side will face out. Pin in position––these become the map sleeves. Sew a seam across the top and bottom of the holder. This seam will keep the sleeves in place and completes the sewing. Slip in a piece of slim cardboard as a backing. Slip inside one sleeve one side, then into the other sleeve on the other side. Fold the map holder in half to complete. Add the map. It's now ready to hit the road!
